titleproper.value: Guide to the Tony Martin Papers, 1960-2018 <num>MSS.190</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-10-25T14:46:14</date>

extent.value: in 3 record cartons, 1 half manuscript box, 1 small flat box, and 1 oversize flat box.

abstract.value: The Tony Martin Papers document Martin's career as a multimedia artist. Martin was one of the first artists to use light as an artistic medium. A recipient of a National Endowment for the Arts Individual Artist Fellowship, Martin has worked regularly with such composers as Pauline Oliveros, Morton Subotnick and David Tudor. The Papers include correspondence, sketches, announcements and other documents pertaining to Martin's artistic production and exhibitions. They also include video and film that was used in Martin's artworks, as well as video documentation of performances.

p.value:
Published citations should take the
following form:<lb/><lb/>
Identification of item,  date (if known); The Tony Martin Papers; MSS 190; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

The Tony Martin Papers were donated to Fales Library by Tony Martin in 2006. Two accretions were added to Series I, Subseries A in December of 2015 and October 2019. The accessions associated with these additions are 2015.190 and 2019.056.

<emph render="bold">Works on DVD/Film/Tape</emph><lb/><lb/>

Baltimore, Rotterdam, Seoul - Film and Video Festivals <lb/>
<emph render="bold">OVERSIZE SERIES</emph> contains oversize documentary and graphic material. Some entries are cross-listed with entries in Series I.

dsc.value:
Series I: Documentary and Graphic Material104831Scope and Contents note

Contains invitations, announcements, catalogues and other material relating to Tony Martin's one-person and group painting exhibitions. The material is arranged chronologically.

Mostly made up of announcements and posters advertising Tony Martin's innovative lighting- and music-integrated performances. The subseries also contains some slides, drawings and negatives pertaining to the visual compositions. The material is arranged chronologically.

Songlines Series, Center for Contemporary Music, Mills College, Oakland, CA1049322006174Miscellaneous slides depicting light projection compositions1049311965-1971175Spectral Created Sound (photographs)156887[n.d.]175.5Subseries C: Interactive Sculptures104923Scope and Contents note

Consists mostly of announcements and photographs pertaining to Tony Martin's interactive sculptures. Abundant sketches and notes (including schematics) relating to material in Subseries C may be found in Subseries D, under "Interactive Sculptures," "New Media Works" and the individual names of the installations.

Interaction Room (or Game Room) (20 x 20 x 10 room containing light and projection installation activated by viewers using game principles) - Howard Wise Gallery, New York, NY ***see also*** Oversize1049291968176Column - Howard Wise Gallery, New York, NY1049281969177Door - Howard Wise Gallery, New York, NY1049271969178General

"The Well" is in the permanent collection of the Everson Museum, Syracuse, NY

You, Me, We - Howard Wise Gallery, New York, NY1049251969180Word Wall - Longridge Plaza, permanent collection, Rochester, NY1049241975181Subseries D: Sketches, Notes & Miscellaneous104908Scope and Contents note

Contains rich material relating to Subseries C: Interactive Sculptures, including handwritten notes, sketches and schematics of electronic circuits. Other material includes contact sheets as well as press clippings pertaining to Tony Martin's works. Subseries D is arranged alphabetically.

Wise, HowardSeries III: Video Recordings and Motion Picture Film104805Conditions Governing Access

There may not be access copies available for all audiovisual material. Please contact a Fales archivist.

Subseries A: Video Recordings104813Scope and Contents note

Consists of screen projections from Tony Martin's visual compositions, recordings of performances and an interview.

Conditions Governing Access

Access copies for some materials are available by appointment for reading room viewing and listening only. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596 to request item by using the access DVD ID number.

Subseries B: Motion Picture Film104806Scope and Contents Note

Consists of Tony Martin's visual compositions, mostly in collaboration with other artists, along with paper documentation regarding some of the works. Paper documents stored within film cans have been removed, foldered, and given the same ID number as the corresponding film element but with a letter B at end of ID number. (Ex. Film: 190.0001A, Folder 190.0001B.)

Conditions Governing Access

Film materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers.
